text: I’ve being doing `("Table 1", df)` at the end of my cells so that the dataframes displayed have a “title”. Is there something less janky?

text: make a markdown cell before this one?

text:
this actually works pretty well:
```begin
   p = plot(rand(10))
   md"""
   ### Figure 2

   $(p)
   """
end```

elements.text:
begin
   p = plot(rand(10))
   md"""
   ### Figure 2

   $(p)
   """
end

text:
Or if you prefer a caption below
```md"""
$(plot(rand(10))
Figure 2. Random numbers are nice.
"""```

elements.text: Or if you prefer a caption below

md"""

Figure 2. Random numbers are nice.

text: I have been trying to make a macro `@annotate` that takes an object (like a df or plot) and a title and caption and generates the markdown, but i failed :disappointed: will probably post to stackoverflow at some point to get help on that.
